etymology.description: 周(周) (zhōu, "circle; complete") + 游(遊) (yóu, "travel; wander") = to travel around; to roam
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 周(周) (zhōu, "circle; complete") and 游(遊) (yóu, "travel; wander") conveys the idea of traveling in a circular or comprehensive manner, suggesting extensive travel or wandering across different places.

examples.chinese: 他周游世界(他周遊世界)。
艺术家周游名城(藝術家周遊名城)，寻找灵感源泉(尋找靈感源泉)。
examples.pinyin: Yìshùjiā zhōuyóu míngchéng, xúnzhǎo línggǎn yuánquán.
examples.english: The artist traveled around famous cities, seeking sources of inspiration.

examples.chinese: 学者周游古国(學者周遊古國)，采撷典故(採擷典故)。
examples.english: The scholar traveled around ancient kingdoms, collecting classic allusions.
